# Instrument

# Instrument

Represents an abstract instrument with notes.

Kind: global abstract class

  • Instrument
    • instance
      • .init(base, range)
      • .generatePath(fileName) ⇒ String
      • .setPlayer(key, note)
      • .getPlayer(note) ⇒ Tone.Player
      • .note(note) ⇒ Note
      • .hasNote(note) ⇒ boolean
      • .play(note, [duration])
    • static
      • .name : string
      • .server ⇒ string
      • .instrumentPath ⇒ string
      • .getKey(note)
      • .formatNote(note) ⇒ String

# instrument.init(base, range)

Should be called from any child class's constructor. Initializes all the notes and audio players for the instrument.

Kind: instance method of Instrument

Param
base
range

# instrument.generatePath(fileName) ⇒ String

Generates the path to load a note from.

Kind: instance method of Instrument
Throws:

  • Error
Param Type
fileName String

# instrument.setPlayer(key, note)

Add a player for a note.

Kind: instance method of Instrument

Param Type
key
note Note

# instrument.getPlayer(note) ⇒ Tone.Player

Get a note's player.

Kind: instance method of Instrument

Param Type
note String

# instrument.note(note) ⇒ Note

Gets a string consisting of:

  1. The pitch CLASS
  2. The octave

Kind: instance method of Instrument

Param Type
note String

Example

const C = someInstrument.note('c3') // C is now a Note object
console.log(C.interval(2))         // D3

# instrument.hasNote(note) ⇒ boolean

Whether an instrument has a note.

Kind: instance method of Instrument

Param Type
note string

# instrument.play(note, [duration])

Play sound, optionally for a duration.

Kind: instance method of Instrument

Param Type Default
note string
[duration] string false

# Instrument.name : string

Returns the instrument's name.

Kind: static property of Instrument

# Instrument.server ⇒ string

The server to load the audio files for the instrument from, can be overridden.

Kind: static property of Instrument

# Instrument.instrumentPath ⇒ string

Returns string to be used when loading audio files from a specific path. Can be easily over-riden for a specific intrument by using the lib to set the instruments name.

Kind: static property of Instrument
Example

lib.set('Piano', () => {return 'MyUltimatePiano'}) // Piano will now load audio files from the
    server/MyUltimatePiano

# Instrument.getKey(note)

Calculates a specific note's key.

Kind: static method of Instrument

Param Type
note Note

# Instrument.formatNote(note) ⇒ String

Turns a string representing a note to upper case.

Kind: static method of Instrument

Param
note
